sources.data_found: This shared resource machine consists of 20 NVIDIA DGX A100 nodes, each with 8 advanced and powerful graphical processing units (GPUs) to accelerate calculations and train AI models.

ManeFrame II: 36 accelerator nodes with one NVIDIA P100 GPU each; 5 virtual desktop nodes with one NVIDIA Quadro M5000 GPU each; Professor Hagstrom has one node with quad NVIDIA K80 GPU accelerators (4,992 CUDA cores each); Professor Minsker has two nodes with dual NVIDIA V100 GPU accelerators each.

M3: Professor Hagstrom has one node with an NVIDIA A100 GPU accelerator with 40 GB; Professor Minsker has two nodes with dual NVIDIA V100 GPU accelerators each; Dr. Matthews has one node with AMD Instinct MI210 GPU.
During the 2021-2022 academic year, Southern Methodist University handed out 90 bachelor's degrees in computer science. The compsci program at SMU awarded 22 master's degrees in 2021-2022.
As of fall 2025, the university had 12,544 students, including 7,545 undergraduates and 4,999 postgraduates.
Southern Methodist University has a total enrollment of 11,842 including 7,115 undergraduate students and 4,727 graduate students. For the academic year 2023-2024.

student_data.notes: Based on degrees awarded data: 90 bachelor's degrees in CS (2021-2022), estimated 360 enrolled undergrads (90 × 4 years). 22 master's degrees awarded, estimated 88 enrolled (22 × 4 semesters/2 years). PhD estimated at 12 based on 3 doctoral degrees mentioned × 4 year average completion. Total enrollment: 11,842 (2023-2024), with 7,115 undergraduates and 4,727 graduate students university-wide.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Professor Hagstrom's node has quad NVIDIA K80 GPU accelerators (ManeFrame II)
5 virtual desktop nodes each with one NVIDIA Quadro M5000 GPU (ManeFrame II)
Dr. Matthews has one node with AMD Instinct MI210 GPU with 64 GB HBM2e memory (M3)

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS + CALCULATIONS:

1) SMU AI SuperPOD: 20 DGX A100 nodes × 8 GPUs/node = 160 A100 (assumed 80GB based on DGX A100 standard config)

2) ManeFrame II (M2):
   - 36 accelerator nodes × 1 P100 GPU/node = 36 P100
   - 5 virtual desktop nodes × 1 Quadro M5000/node = 5 Quadro M5000
   - Hagstrom node: 1 node × 4 K80 GPUs = 4 K80
   - Minsker nodes: 2 nodes × 2 V100 GPUs/node = 4 V100

3) ManeFrame III (M3):
   - Hagstrom node: 1 A100 40GB
   - Minsker nodes: 2 nodes × 2 V100 GPUs/node = 4 V100
   - Matthews node: 1 AMD Instinct MI210

TOTAL GPU COUNT:
- A100 80GB: 160 (SuperPOD)
- A100 40GB: 1 (M3)
- V100: 8 (4 from M2 + 4 from M3)
- P100: 36 (M2)
- Other GPUs listed in other_high_vram_gpus section

analysis_notes: Data collected from multiple sources. GPU counts calculated from node specifications. Student enrollment estimated from degree completion data (90 CS bachelor's degrees × 4 years = 360 undergrad estimate). Note: SMU announced plans in 2021 for additional GPU infrastructure but specific models/counts not found in current deployment.
